alert.note: Alert for Big Horn (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 25 at 6:13AM MDT until June 26 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Bighorn River at Basin affecting Big Horn County. For the Bighorn River Basin...including Basin...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and continued snowmelt has brought river levels above bankfull. * WHERE...Bighorn River at Basin. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Minor agricultural flooding begins upstream and downstream of Basin. At 9.5 feet, Bankfull stage. Minor agricultural flooding continues to expand upstream and downstream of Basin. At 10.0 feet, Moderate to major agricultural flooding intensifies and becomes more widespread upstream and downstream of Basin. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 AM MDT Sunday, June 25, the stage was 10.3 feet. It will slowly lower to below 10 feet by Monday morning and to near action stage Tuesday morning. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.0 feet this morning. - Action stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
